verses.latin: Paulus, vinctus Christi Iesu, et Timotheus frater, Philemoni dilecto, et adiutori nostro,
verses.english: Paul, a prisoner for Christ Jesus, and Timothy, our brother in faith, to Philemon, our beloved coworker,

verses.latin: et Appiae sorori, et Archippo commilitoni nostro, et ecclesiae, quae in domo tua est.
verses.english: and to Apphia, our sister in faith, to Archippus, our fellow soldier for Christ, and to the Church that meets in your home.

verses.latin: Gratia vobis, et pax a Deo Patre nostro, et Domino Iesu Christo.
verses.english: Grace and peace be with you from God our Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Gratias ago Deo meo, semper memoriam tui faciens in orationibus meis,
verses.english: I always thank my God and remember you in my prayers,

verses.latin: audiens caritatem tuam, et fidem, quam habes in Domino Iesu, et in omnes sanctos:
verses.english: because I hear about your love and the faith you have in the Lord Jesus Christ, and how you show it to all the holy people in the Church.

verses.latin: ut communicatio fidei tuae evidens fiat in agnitione omnis boni, quod est in vobis in Christo Iesu.
verses.english: I pray that the sharing of your faith may become effective through your recognition of every good thing that is in you in Christ Jesus.

verses.latin: Gaudium enim magnum habui, et consolationem in caritate tua, quia viscera sanctorum requieverunt per te, frater.
verses.english: For I have received great joy and comfort from your love, because you have refreshed the hearts and lives of the holy people, my brother.

verses.latin: Propter quod multam fiduciam habens in Christo Iesu, ut tibi praeciperem quod ad rem pertinet,
verses.english: Therefore, although I have much confidence in Christ to command you to do what is proper,

verses.latin: propter caritatem magis obsecro: cum sis talis ut Paulus senex, et nunc vinctus Iesu Christi:
verses.english: I rather appeal to you because of love. I, Paul, am an old man now, and also a prisoner for Christ Jesus.

verses.latin: obsecro te de meo filio, quem genui in vinculis, Onesimo,
verses.english: I appeal to you for my son, Onesimus, whom I have fathered spiritually while I have been in prison.

verses.latin: qui tibi aliquando inutilis fuit, nunc autem et mihi et tibi utilis.
verses.english: He was once useless to you, but now he is useful to both you and me.

verses.latin: Quem remisi tibi. Tu autem illum, id est, mea viscera, suscipe.
verses.english: I am sending him back to you. Please receive him, that is to say, receive my very heart and soul.

verses.latin: Quem ego volueram mecum detinere, ut pro te mihi ministraret in vinculis Evangelii:
verses.english: I truly wanted to keep him with me, so that he could serve me on your behalf while I am in prison for the Gospel.

verses.latin: sine consilio autem tuo nihil volui facere: ut non quasi de necessitate bonum tuum esset, sed voluntarium.
verses.english: But I did not want to do anything without your consent, so that your good deed would not be forced but rather a voluntary act of your free will.

verses.latin: Forsitan enim ideo discessit ad horam a te, ut aeternam illum haberes:
verses.english: For perhaps he departed from you for a short time for this very reason: that you might have him back forever,

verses.latin: jam non ut servum, sed pro servo carissimum fratrem, maxime autem et mihi, quanto magis tibi et in carne, et in Domino?
verses.english: no longer as a slave, but as a beloved brotherâ€”far more than a slave. He is especially beloved to me, and how much more so to you, both physically (in the flesh) and spiritually (in the Lord)?

verses.latin: Si ergo habes me socium, suscipe illum sicut me:
verses.english: So if you consider me a partner in the faith, welcome him as you would welcome me.

verses.latin: si autem aliquid nocuit tibi, aut debet, hoc mihi imputa.
verses.english: If he has wronged you in any way, or owes you anything, charge it to my account.

verses.latin: Ego Paulus scripsi mea manu: ego reddam: ut non dicam tibi, quoniam et teipsum mihi debes.
verses.english: I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand: I will repay you. I do not need to mention that you owe me even your very self.

verses.latin: Ita, frater, ego te fruar in Domino: refice viscera mea in Domino.
verses.english: Yes, my brother, let me benefit from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart and soul in Christ.

verses.latin: Confidens in obedientia tua scripsi tibi: sciens quoniam et super id, quod dico, facies.
verses.english: I write to you confident in your obedience, knowing that you will do even more than what I am asking.

verses.latin: Simul autem et para mihi hospitium: nam spero per orationes vestras donari me vobis.
verses.english: Also, at the same time, prepare a guest room for me, for I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.

verses.latin: Salutat te Epaphras concaptivus meus in Christo Iesu,
verses.english: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you his greetings.

verses.latin: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, adiutores mei.
verses.english: Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my coworkers, also greet you.

verses.latin: Gratia Domini nostri Iesu Christi cum spiritu vestro. Amen.
verses.english: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
